items.sentence: I know why Tom didn\'t want to go to Boston with Mary.
I\'m quite certain I don\'t want to be married to you.
I\'m still in Boston, but I\'ll be back home tomorrow.
Tom turned off the engine, but left the headlights on.
Tom used to spend a lot of time with his grandparents.
Tom was satisfied with the way Mary cleaned his house.
Please be sure to turn off the light before you leave.
Please wait until I have finished writing this letter.
I\'m very serious about wanting to be a good magician.
If I had a choice, I probably wouldn\'t be doing this.
I don\'t think I\'ll ever sound like a native speaker.
I don\'t yet know how much money we\'re going to need.
Why didn\'t you tell me you didn\'t understand French?
Tom knew that he couldn\'t get to the airport by 2:30.
She has a tendency to look on the dark side of things.
She is accustomed to doing her homework before dinner.
She visits him quite often, but never stays very long.
Slavery has been abolished in most parts of the world.
I didn\'t even know that you knew how to speak French.
I didn\'t know Tom used to be a professional musician.
